title: A Case of Post-Acute COVID-19 Syndrome with Musculoskeletal Manifestations
clinical_history: A 45-year-old previously healthy male, who works as an accountant, presented with a 6-week history of persistent fatigue, muscle aches, and joint pains following a moderate COVID-19 infection. He initially experienced fever, cough, and shortness of breath, which resolved within two weeks. However, he continued to experience debilitating fatigue, generalized muscle aches, and joint pains, particularly in the lower limbs.

nprs.affected_area: Bilateral lower limb muscle aches and pains, particularly in the quadriceps, hamstrings, and gluteal regions
Intermittent sharp pains in the bilateral knee joints

aggrevating_factors: Prolonged standing, walking, or climbing stairs; changing positions from sitting to standing
picture: A 24-hour pain profile showing fluctuating levels of pain throughout the day, with a gradual increase in pain levels towards the evening
easing_factors: Rest, relaxation, and application of heat to the affected areas
past_history: No significant past medical history; occasional episodes of lower back pain following prolonged sitting or bending
medical_history: COVID-19 infection 6 weeks prior to presentation, managed conservatively; no hospitalizations or intensive care unit admissions
medications: Acetaminophen 1000mg as needed for pain and fever; occasional use of ibuprofen 400mg for pain relief
personal_history: Married with two children; works full-time as an accountant; enjoys hiking and playing sports in his free time, but has had to significantly reduce these activities due to persistent symptoms
imaging: None to date; pending further evaluation with MRI or ultrasound to rule out other potential causes of musculoskeletal symptoms
